portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.intro: Exploring the intersection of natural materials and contemporary art through textile installations and sculptural forms.

funguy.title: Fun-guy
funguy.description: An installation consisting of four light objects. Each object functions both as an independent artwork and a functional light fixture. Each individual object measures 150x30x30cm. The illuminated, brownish translucent part - the "lampshade" is made using cellulose fiber grown by the author using symbiotic bacterial culture.

rainbow.title: Varavīksnene
rainbow.description: Located in the middle of the exhibition, this object made of wool, polyester, and composite materials features a rainbow-colored eye observing the space. It challenges viewers to contemplate how differently each person might perceive the same view.

atgazend.title: Atgazend
atgazend.description: A textile graffiti installation at Atgāzene station in Riga, Latvia's smallest neighborhood (0.745 sq km). This work serves as a festive farewell to the station slated for closure, using textile as an unconventional medium to honor the neighborhood's identity. The fragile nature of textile graffiti mirrors the vulnerability of the area, which may be absorbed by surrounding districts. The project creates a non-verbal dialogue with street artists, transforming the station's name into a symbol of impermanence and celebration of everyday life.

biography.title: Biography
biography.intro: A multicultural - interdimensional personality who enjoys living in a dream world while trying to stay grounded and connected to the cultures found on Earth.

background.title: Background and Early Career
background.content: Known professionally as Ilze Brenn, I studied at the Art Academy of Latvia, where I developed my unique approach to textile art combining traditional craftsmanship with contemporary artistic expression.
